longInfo:
Passport required.
- Nationals of Switzerland are allowed to enter with an
  expired passport. The passport is accepted when expired for
  a maximum of 5 years. 
- Nationals of Switzerland traveling without a passport must
  have a document accepted for entry, valid on arrival. 
Passport Exemptions:
- Holders of a National ID Card: 
 - issued to nationals of Switzerland; 

VISA NOT REQUIRED.

Minors:
- WARNING! In accordance with European Union (EU) Legislation,
  all minors who are nationals of Switzerland will be expected
  to hold their own passport or National ID Card (where
  applicable) when departing from Bulgaria, Croatia, Cyprus,
  Romania or a Schengen Member State . 
- All minors who are nationals of Switzerland are expected to
  hold their own travel document.
Additional Information:
- Valid visas in full, invalidated travel documents are
  accepted provided accompanied by a new travel document.
- Extension of stay is possible for visa exempt visitors. They
  must report to the Police Headquarters in Malta, no later
  than one week prior to expiration of visa exemption
vaccination:
Vaccination against yellow fever required if arriving within 6
days after leaving or transiting countries with risk of yellow
fever transmission For details, click here.

Exempt from Yellow Fever vaccination:
- Children under 9 months of age who are subject to isolation
  or surveillance when indicated. 
- Passengers transiting countries with risk of yellow fever
  transmission provided not leaving the transit areas.
